segments.en: Linked Discourses 16
1. Kassapa
4. Visiting Families
At Sāvatthī.
“What do you think, mendicants?

segments.pli: kathaṃrūpo bhikkhu arahati kulūpako hotuṃ, kathaṃrūpo bhikkhu na arahati kulūpako hotun”ti?
segments.en: What kind of mendicant is worthy of visiting families? And what kind of mendicant is not worthy of visiting families?”
“Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. …”
The Buddha said this:

segments.pli: “Yo hi koci, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃcitto kulāni upasaṅkamati:
segments.en: “Whoever visits families with the thought:
‘May they give to me, may they not fail to give.
May they give a lot, not a little.
May they give me fine things, not coarse.
May they give quickly, not slowly.
May they give carefully, not carelessly.’

segments.pli: Tassa ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno evaṃcittassa kulāni upasaṅkamato na denti, tena bhikkhu sandīyati; so tatonidānaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedayati.
segments.en: If a mendicant with such a thought approaches a family and they don’t give, the mendicant feels slighted. And they experience pain and sadness because of that.
If they give only a little …
if they give coarse things …

segments.pli: dandhaṃ denti, no sīghaṃ, tena bhikkhu sandīyati; so tatonidānaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedayati.
segments.en: if they give slowly …

segments.pli: Asakkaccaṃ denti, no sakkaccaṃ; tena bhikkhu sandīyati; so tatonidānaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedayati.
segments.en: if they give carelessly, the mendicant feels slighted. And they experience pain and sadness because of that.

segments.pli: Evarūpo kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na arahati kulūpako hotuṃ.
segments.en: That kind of mendicant is not worthy of visiting families.

segments.pli: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃcitto kulāni upasaṅkamati:
segments.en: Whoever visits families with the thought:
‘When among other families, how could I possibly think:
“May they give to me, may they not fail to give.
May they give a lot, not a little.
May they give me fine things, not coarse.
May they give quickly, not slowly.
May they give carefully, not carelessly.”’

segments.pli: Tassa ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno evaṃcittassa kulāni upasaṅkamato na denti; tena bhikkhu na sandīyati; so na tatonidānaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedayati.
segments.en: If a mendicant with such a thought approaches a family and they don’t give, the mendicant doesn’t feel slighted. And they don’t experience pain and sadness because of that.

segments.pli: Thokaṃ denti, no bahukaṃ; tena bhikkhu na sandīyati; so na tatonidānaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedayati.
segments.en: If they give only a little …

segments.pli: Lūkhaṃ denti, no paṇītaṃ; tena bhikkhu na sandīyati; so na tatonidānaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedayati.
segments.en: if they give coarse things …

segments.pli: Dandhaṃ denti, no sīghaṃ; tena bhikkhu na sandīyati; so na tatonidānaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedayati.
segments.en: if they give slowly …

segments.pli: Asakkaccaṃ denti, no sakkaccaṃ; tena bhikkhu na sandīyati; so na tatonidānaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedayati.
segments.en: if they give carelessly, the mendicant doesn’t feel slighted. And they don’t experience pain and sadness because of that.

segments.pli: Evarūpo kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu arahati kulūpako hotuṃ.
segments.en: That kind of mendicant is worthy of visiting families.
Kassapa visits families with the thought:
‘When among other families, how could I possibly think:
“May they give to me, may they not fail to give.
May they give a lot, not a little.
May they give me fine things, not coarse.
May they give quickly, not slowly.
May they give carefully, not carelessly.”’

segments.pli: Tassa ce, bhikkhave, kassapassa evaṃcittassa kulāni upasaṅkamato na denti; tena kassapo na sandīyati; so na tatonidānaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedayati.
segments.en: With such a thought, if he approaches a family and they don’t give, he doesn’t feel slighted. And he doesn’t experience pain and sadness because of that.

segments.pli: Thokaṃ denti, no bahukaṃ; tena kassapo na sandīyati; so na tatonidānaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedayati.
segments.en: If they give only a little …

segments.pli: Lūkhaṃ denti, no paṇītaṃ; tena kassapo na sandīyati; so na tatonidānaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedayati.
segments.en: if they give coarse things …

segments.pli: Dandhaṃ denti, no sīghaṃ; tena kassapo na sandīyati; so na tatonidānaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedayati.
segments.en: if they give slowly …

segments.pli: Asakkaccaṃ denti, no sakkaccaṃ; tena kassapo na sandīyati; so na tatonidānaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedayati.
segments.en: if they give carelessly, he doesn’t feel slighted. And he doesn’t experience pain and sadness because of that.

segments.pli: Kassapena vā hi vo, bhikkhave, ovadissāmi yo vā panassa kassapasadiso. Ovaditehi ca pana vo tathattāya paṭipajjitabban”ti.
segments.en: I will exhort you with the example of Kassapa or someone like him. You should practice accordingly.”

suttaplex.blurb: Some mendicants approach families in the hope of receiving fine gifts or respect—but not Kassapa.
